support_summary: AXIN1, a key scaffolding protein of the β-catenin destruction complex, directly binds to TFEB in the cytoplasm. This interaction sequesters TFEB, preventing its nuclear translocation in the absence of a Wnt signal. Upon Wnt activation, TFEB dissociates from AXIN1, allowing it to move to the nucleus.

functions.function: TFEB Cytoplasmic Sequestration in Wnt-Off State
functions.cellular_process: In the absence of Wnt signaling (Wnt-off state), AXIN1 acts as a scaffold within the β-catenin destruction complex to directly bind and sequester TFEB in the cytoplasm. This prevents TFEB from entering the nucleus and activating its target genes.
functions.effect_description: AXIN1 binding inhibits TFEB's nuclear localization and transcriptional activity by retaining it within the cytoplasmic destruction complex.
biological_consequence: Wnt-off state → TFEB binds the AXIN1 scaffold within the β-catenin destruction complex → TFEB is sequestered in the cytoplasm → TFEB nuclear translocation and transcriptional activity are inhibited
Wnt-on state → Destruction complex disassembles → TFEB is released from AXIN1 → TFEB translocates to the nucleus to participate in Wnt-dependent transcription
specific_effects: Directly interacts with TFEB in the cytoplasm.
Sequesters TFEB as part of the β-catenin destruction complex.
Prevents TFEB nuclear translocation in the absence of Wnt signaling.

evidence.paper_title: PARsylated transcription factor EB (TFEB) regulates the expression of a subset of Wnt target genes by forming a complex with β-catenin-TCF/LEF1
evidence.authors: Kim S, Song G, Lee T, Kim M, Kim J, Kwon H, Kim J, Jeong W, Lee U, Na C, Kang S, Kim W, Seong JK, Jho EH
evidence.relevant_quote: Immunoprecipitation (IP) assays revealed that TFEB and Axin interacts at the overexpression condition as well as endogenous level...These data suggest that TFEB is part of the β-catenin destruction complex...

mechanism: In the absence of Wnt signaling (Wnt-off state), AXIN1 acts as a scaffold within the β-catenin destruction complex to directly bind and sequester TFEB in the cytoplasm. This prevents TFEB from entering the nucleus and activating its target genes.
effect: AXIN1 binding inhibits TFEB's nuclear localization and transcriptional activity by retaining it within the cytoplasmic destruction complex.
summary: TFEB inhibits AXIN1 to modulate tfeb cytoplasmic sequestration in wnt-off state, ultimately affecting tfeb nuclear translocation and transcriptional activity are inhibited.
